properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 1 at 10:38AM EST until January 6 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County
Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County
Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County

.Water following recent rounds of heavy rain continues to work through
the river systems in West Michigan. Smaller and medium-sized rivers are
near crest or have already crested. Larger rivers, such as the Grand
and Muskegon, will continue to see crests working westward towards Lake
Michigan over the next several days. Additional rain expected Thursday
night through Friday night looks to mainly stay southeast of the area,
and is not expected to cause additional flooding on area rivers. The
following forecast is based on observed and forecast 48 hour
precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Grand River near Comstock Park.
* until late Sunday night.
* at  9:22 AM Wednesday the stage was 11.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, the river will continue rising to near 12.6 feet this
evening. The river will fall below flood stage this weekend.
* Impact, at 13.0 feet...Abrigador Trail is underwater and minor
flooding of homes occurs along Abrigador Trail and Willow Drive.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 12.8 feet
on Mar 20 2014.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
